articles.title: Lao President Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
Lao President Meets WPK Delegation
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Choummaly Saynasone, president of Laos and general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, on December 6 met and had a conversation with the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, on a visit to his country. 
					The President extended warm congratulations to General Secretary Kim Jong Il on his reelection as general secretary of the WPK at its conference.
					
					 He noted that the Lao party and government would continue to boost the friendly relations between the two parties and the two countries which were provided by Kaysone Phomvihane and President Kim Il Sung. 
					
					 He expressed the belief that the Korean people would frustrate the moves of the imperialists to stifle the DPRK and surely build a thriving nation under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Talks between WPK and LPRP Held
articles.content:
Talks between WPK and LPRP Held
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party were held in Vientiane on Monday. 
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the WPK led by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK, and DPRK Ambassador to Laos Han Pong Ho and from the Lao side the members of the LPRP delegation headed by Vice-Prime Minister and Foreign Minister Thongloun Sisoulith, member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the C.C., the LPRP. 
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of their party activities and exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and issues of common concern. 
					
					 The LPRP Central Committee hosted a reception in honor of the WPK delegation that day.

articles.title: Agreement Signed between WPK and LPRP
articles.content:
Agreement Signed between WPK and LPRP
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- An agreement on cooperation and exchange of delegations between the Workers' Party of Korea and the Lao People's Revolutionary Party was signed in Vientiane on December 6. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the WPK headed by Kim Yong Il, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and Han Pong Ho, DPRK ambassador to Laos, and from the Lao side members of the delegation of the LPRP headed by Thongloun Sisoulith, vice-prime minister and foreign minister and member of the Political Bureau and chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the LPRP. 
					
					 The agreement was inked by Kim Yong Il and Thongloun Sisoulith.

articles.title: Entries into National Prize Contest of Greening Layouts Exhibited
articles.content:
Entries into National Prize Contest of Greening Layouts Exhibited
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of entries into the national prize contest of greening layouts took place at the Grand People's Study House on December 7 and 8.
					 On display at the exhibition were more than 250 layouts presented by the Paektusan Architectural Institute, the Mansudae Art Studio, the Pyongyang Horticulture Guidance Bureau, the City Management Research Institute under the State Academy of Sciences, Pyongyang University of Construction and Building-Materials Industry, Wonsan University of Agriculture, etc.
					
					 The exhibition was divided into greening layouts for revolutionary sites, major squares, spots, parks, recreation grounds and residential districts and those for big potted flower stands and small structures.
					
					 Appreciated by the participants were at least 60 greening layouts including the one for the road in front of  the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, the one for potted flower stands at the entrance to the Pyongyang-Hyangsan Tourist Road, the one for the tower to the immortality of President Kim Il Sung and layouts for residential districts and parks.
					
					 A closing ceremony took place on Dec. 8.
					
					 Hwang Hak Won, minister of Urban Management, in his closing speech called for positively introducing excellent layouts into realities in an effort to turn the country into a more beautiful socialist land of bliss good to live in.

articles.title: National House of Class Education Draws Large Crowd
articles.content:
National House of Class Education Draws Large Crowd
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and people from all walks of life and school youth and children are visiting the National House of Class Education every day.
					 More than 328,000 people have visited it this year and their number is on the steady increase since the south Korean puppet forces' firing shells into territorial waters of the DPRK side.
					
					 The hearts of the visitors were burning with irrepressible hatred when watching photos and evidence proving the provocations perpetrated by the U.S. imperialists in areas along the Military Demarcation Line, the barbaric bacteriological warfare waged by them in violation of international law and their crafty schemes to evade the responsibility for igniting the Korean War, etc. and a video and evidence laying bare the criminal acts of the south Korean rulers.
					
					 They renewed their resolution to mercilessly wipe out the south Korean puppet group after resolutely turning out in a battle to defend the country should it start a war, backed by outside forces.

articles.title: Book on Songun Politics Published
articles.content:
Book on Songun Politics Published
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House has recently brought out a new book, "Love-based Songun Politics".
					 The book contains stories about love-based politics pursued by General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who, regarding Songun as the basic mode of socialist politics, has safeguarded the country, the people and the destiny of socialism by dint of arms and wisely guided the effort for the prosperity of the nation.
					
					 It also shows that Songun politics finds its true viability, great influence and strong might in arms.

articles.title: Signal Achievements Made in Iron and Steel Production
articles.content:
Signal Achievements Made in Iron and Steel Production 
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The officials, workers and technicians of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex boosted the production of pig iron 2.5 times, that of steel 4.2 times and that of rolled steel 6.7 times as of early in December as compared with those in the corresponding period of last year. 
					 The blast furnace shop daily increased the production of pig iron and the Juche iron-based blast furnace shop and steel shops No. 1 and 2 brought about a surge in production while the hot-rolling shop upped the production of rolled steel per unit hour. 
					
					 Sintering shops No. 1 and 2 overfulfilled their monthly plans while the coke shop, the fire-resisting material shop and the pipeline transport office contributed to boosting the iron and steel production.

articles.title: Coal Output on Increase
articles.content:
Coal Output on Increase
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Coal output is on a steady increase in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Collieries belonging to the Anju Area Coal Mining Complex have enlarged pits to increase the proportion of mining by machines and fulfill their daily assignments at 120 percent.
					
					 Those belonging to the Sunchon Area Youth Coal Mining Complex, including the Chonsong, February 8 Jikdong and Sinchang youth coal mines are giving priority to tunnelling to sharply boost the output.
					
					 The Ungok Coal Mine has developed a large coalfield to double its output, while the Namdok Coal Mine has been topping its daily target.
					
					 Coal mines in Tokchon area, with detailed plans for the winter time, have raised the output through continuous drilling and blasts and full operation of vehicles.
					
					 Increased production has also been reported from the Kangdong, Kyongwon, Onsong, Chonnae and Myongchon area coal mining complexes.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Leadership Lauded by Foreign Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Leadership Lauded by Foreign Figures
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- Foreign figures who visited the DPRK at the head of delegations warmly praised General Secretary Kim Jong Il for having made immortal contributions to accomplishing the socialist cause.
					 Rohekele Andre who visited the DPRK at the head of a delegation of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo praised Kim Jong Il as a great thinker and theoretician and a master of politics, adding that he has firmly defended and glorified Korean-style socialism with his original Songun politics.
					
					 Wardiyatmo who visited the DPRK at the head of an Indonesian government cultural delegation lauded Kim Jong Il as a great guardian of socialism, stressing that thanks to him the DPRK has demonstrated its dignity and might before the whole world.
					
					 The successes made by the Korean people have instilled energy and encouragement into the world revolutionary people, Wardiyatmo noted.
					
					 D. Michka who visited the DPRK, leading a Mongolian delegation for commemorating the Day of the Sun, had this to say: 
					
					 The Korean people are dynamically advancing under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 The Korean people wisely led by Kim Jong Il are now demonstrating their heroic stamina before the whole world.
					
					 The successes made in the DPRK are the precious fruition of the indomitable mental power displayed by the army and people remaining boundlessly loyal to the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Subash Kaji Shrestha who visited the DPRK at the head of a delegation of the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal said that Kim Jong Il is glorifying Korean socialism, a legacy of President Kim Il Sung, with his outstanding leadership.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Its Involvement in Korean War
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Its Involvement in Korean War 
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed by world media recently that officers of the Imperial Japanese Army drew up and provided strategic maps which had detailed descriptions of the topography of Korea for the U.S. imperialist aggression forces to help them in military operations including their air raids during the past Korean War. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The above-said fact amounts to a very grave war crime and an unpardonable crime against humanity.
					
					  But for these maps, the land would not have been reduced to so awful debris and so many innocent peaceable civilians would not have been killed. If it were not for these maps, Korea would not have remained divided for more than half a century.
					
					 The landing operation in Inchon was carried out by the U.S. imperialists during the Korean War in accordance with the map provided by the Yamasaki Institution. 
					
					 During the war Japan offered the U.S. imperialists its territory as logistic, supply and sortie bases for carrying out their war of aggression.
					
					 Using U.S. marine and air force bases in Okinawa and other parts of Japan its various type warships and fighters committed barbarous air raids and bombardments in Korea. Japan also dispatched military personnel to the Korean front to help the U.S. in its military operations.
					
					 The germ warfare perpetrated by the U.S. imperialists in Korea would have been unthinkable without the cooperation of Japanese experts on germ warfare. 
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK still remember well the criminal acts committed by Japan during the Korean War and their serious consequences. They have, at the same time, strictly keep tabs on the hideous war crimes committed by Japan against the DPRK.
					
					 If Japan takes part in the second Korean War to be ignited by the U.S. imperialists, the army and people of the DPRK will certainly force it to pay not only for the crimes committed by it in the past but for those perpetrated by it during the last Korean War and for what it will do in the second Korean War.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Observed in Sweden
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Observed in Sweden 
Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association released a special issue of its magazine "Korean Information" on December 2 on the occasions of the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 The magazine carried a photo of Kim Jong Il waving back to the enthusiastically cheering crowd from the tribune of honor of the military parade celebrating the 65th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and an article devoted to the day.
					
					 The magazine said in the article that Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the KPA on December 24, 1991 marked a historic event of great significance in ensuring the peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Thanks to the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il, the Korean people could victoriously conclude the arduous march and firmly defend the sovereignty of the country and the socialist system, shattering the imperialist allied forces' moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					 His Songun politics provided a sure guarantee for paving the way for achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the nation and opening up a landmark phase of building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 December 24 also marks the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 The Korean people are significantly commemorating her birth anniversary.
					
					 The magazine carried news that the Conference of the WPK was successfully held in the DPRK and an international preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Copenhagen.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days Commemorated
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days Commemorated
 Pyongyang, December 8 (KCNA) -- A seminar on the Songun leadership feats performed by Kim Jong Il was held in the Czech Republic, a lecture in Democratic Congo and a film show in Myanmar on December 1 and 3 on the occasions of the 19th anniversary of his assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine. 
					 They were attended by personages of Newspaper Dialog of the Czech Republic, the Art and Vocational Training School of Democratic Congo and the Myanmar Nine Lion Trading Company Ltd. and masses. 
					
					 The participants of the film show watched Korean film "Arms of Korea."
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.

articles.title: Choummaly Saynasone se refiere a relaciones de amistad con Corea
articles.content:
Choummaly Saynasone se refiere a relaciones de amistad con Corea
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Choummaly Saynasone, secretario general del Comite Central del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao y presidente de la Republica Democratica Popular Lao, departio el dia 6 con la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea presidida por el miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Yong Il, de visita en su pais. 
					  En la ocasion el mandatario lao dio su calida felicitacion al Dirigente Kim Jong Il por su reeleccion como Secretario General del PTC en la Conferencia de este partido.
					
					   El partido y el gobierno de Laos seguiran desarrollando invariablemente las relaciones de amistad entre los dos partidos y dos paises preparadas por el camarada Kaysone Phombihane y el Presidente Kim Il Sung, apunto.
					
					  Expreso la conviccion de que bajo la direccion del Songun del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano construira sin falta una gran potencia prospera frustrando las maniobras de aplastamiento de los imperialistas.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y el PPRL
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones del PTC y el PPRL
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 6 en Vientiane las conservaciones entre las delegaciones del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del PTC encabezada por el miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Yong Il, y el embajador coreano en Laos, Han Pong Ho, y por la laosiana, los integrantes de la delegacion del PPRL presidida por el viceprimer ministro y canciller, Thongloun Sisoulth, miembro del Buro Politico del CC y presidente de la Comision de Relaciones Exteriores del PPRL.
					
					  Ambas partes se informaron sobre las actividades de sus respectivos partidos e intercambiaron opiniones sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos partidos y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					  Ese dia, el CC del PPRL ofrecio un banquete en honor de la delegacion coreana.

articles.title: Firmado acuerdo entre PTC y PPRL
articles.content:
Firmado acuerdo entre PTC y PPRL
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 6 en Vientiane el acuerdo sobre la cooperacion e intercambio de delegaciones entre el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Partido Popular Revolucionario Lao.
					En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del PTC encabezada por el miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Yong Il, y el embajador coreano en Laos, Han Pong Ho, y por la laosiana, los integrantes de la delegacion del PPRL presidida por el viceprimer ministro y canciller, Thongloun Sisoulth, miembro del Buro Politico del CC y presidente de la Comision de Relaciones Exteriores del PPRL.
					
					Kim Yong Il y Thongloun Sisoulth suscribieron el document.

articles.title: Personalidades extranjeras elogian al Dirigente Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Personalidades extranjeras elogian al Dirigente Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Los jefes de las delegaciones de varios paises, de visita en Corea, alabaron la noble personalidad del Dirigente       Kim Jong Il quien contribuye enormemente al cumplimiento de la causa socialista.
					  El jefe de la delegacion del Comite Nacional para el Estudio de la Idea Juche del Congo Democratico, Rohekele Andre, senalo que Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il es gran ideologo y teorico y gran maestro de la politica y destaco que el defiende con firmeza el socialismo coreano y lo glorifica practicando la original politica de Songun. 
					
					  Wardiyatmo, quien presidio la delegacion cultural gubernamental de la Republica de Indonesia, dijo  que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il es gran defensor del socialismo y agrego que gracias a el, Corea manifiesta a todo el mundo su dignidad y poderio. 
					
					  Los exitos, que alcanza el pueblo coreano, estimulan a los pueblos revolucionarios del mundo, apunto.
					
					  El jefe de la delegacion de Mongolia para conmemorar el Dia del Sol (15 de abril, dia de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung), D. Michka, afirmo que el pueblo coreano avanza a pasos firmes bajo la bandera del Songun, y continuo:
					
					  El pueblo coreano, que cuenta con la sabia guia de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il, exalta a todo el mundo su impetu heroico. 
					
					  Los exitos, que se logran en Corea, son noble fruto de la indoblegable potencia espiritual del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea infinitamente fieles a la direccion del Songun de Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Subash Kaji Shrestha, quien encabezo la delegacion de la Asociacion de Estudio de la Autoconfianza de Nepal, puntualizo que Su Excelencia Kim Jong Il glorifica con su destacada orientacion el socialismo coreano, herencia dejada por el Presidente Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Se incrementa la produccion en minas de carbon
articles.content:
Se incrementa la produccion en minas de carbon
Pyongyang, 8 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Las minas de carbon en distintas localidades de Corea aumentan la produccion contribuyendo a la mejora de la vida del pueblo.
					  Las minas del Complejo Carbonifero de la Zona de Anju cumplen en 120 por ciento el plan diario formando amplia zona de extraccion y elevando la proporcion de trabajos mecanizados.
					
					  Las Minas Carboniferas Juventud de Chonsong, de Jikdong 8 de Febrero y de Sinchang, y otras del Complejo Carbonifero Juventud de la Zona de Sunchon incrementan considerablemente la produccion anteponiendo la perforacion a la extraccion de carbon, lo cual trae el aumento productivo tambien en las fabricas y empresas que usan ese tipo de combustible.
					
					  La Mina de Carbon de Ungok busco un campo carbonifero para duplicar la produccion y transporta a tiempo todo el carbon extraido.
					
					Mientras tanto, la Mina de Carbon de Namdok produce en estos dias mucho mas carbon que el plan diario y lo suministra a las centrales termoelectricas y otras unidades.
					
					  Segun el minucioso plan de produccion para la estacion invernal, las minas de carbon de la zona de Tokchon realizan la perforacion y voladura continuas y ponen en pleno funcionamiento los medios de transporte, de manera que crezca cada dia mas el monton de ese combustible fosil.
					
					  Los exitos de produccion se amplian tambien en los Complejos Carboniferos de las Zonas de Kangdong, Kyongwon, Onsong, Chonnae y Myongchon donde se organizan detalladamente las labores economicas.
